text: The 1783 English cricket season was the 12th in which matches have been awarded retrospective first-class cricket status. The scorecards of four first-class matches have survived. == Matches == Four first-class match scorecards survive from 1783, including two matches between Kent XIs and Hampshire XIs.Association of Cricket Statisticians and Historians (ACS) (1981) A Guide to Important Cricket Matches Played in the British Isles 1709 – 1863. Nottingham: ACS.Results, English Domestic Season 1783, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-03-11. One of these matches, played in July at Windmill Down, is the first first-class match known to have finished as a tie.Hampshire XI v Kent XI, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-04-05. ==Other events== A portrait of Edward "Lumpy" Stevens was probably executed this year. The picture is at Knole House, seat of the Duke of Dorset in Sevenoaks. ==First mentions== * Stephen Amherst * Couchman (Kent) * James Wells ==References== ==Further reading== * * * * * Category:1783 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1764 to 1786
title: 1783 English cricket season
